00064 static void __import_set_state(struct obd_import *imp,
00065                                enum lustre_imp_state state)
00066 {
00067         switch (state) {
00068         case LUSTRE_IMP_CLOSED:
00069         case LUSTRE_IMP_NEW:
00070         case LUSTRE_IMP_DISCON:
00071         case LUSTRE_IMP_CONNECTING:
00072                 break;
00073         case LUSTRE_IMP_REPLAY_WAIT:
00074                 imp->imp_replay_state = LUSTRE_IMP_REPLAY_LOCKS;
00075                 break;
00076         default:
00077                 imp->imp_replay_state = LUSTRE_IMP_REPLAY;
00078         }
00079         imp->imp_state = state;
00080         imp->imp_state_hist[imp->imp_state_hist_idx].ish_state = state;
00081         imp->imp_state_hist[imp->imp_state_hist_idx].ish_time =
00082                 cfs_time_current_sec();
00083         imp->imp_state_hist_idx = (imp->imp_state_hist_idx + 1) %
00084                 IMP_STATE_HIST_LEN;
00085 }
00086 
00087 /* A CLOSED import should remain so. */
00088 #define IMPORT_SET_STATE_NOLOCK(imp, state)                                    \
00089 do {                                                                           \
00090         if (imp->imp_state != LUSTRE_IMP_CLOSED) {                             \
00091                CDEBUG(D_HA, "%p %s: changing import state from %s to %s\n",    \
00092                       imp, obd2cli_tgt(imp->imp_obd),                          \
00093                       ptlrpc_import_state_name(imp->imp_state),                \
00094                       ptlrpc_import_state_name(state));                        \
00095                __import_set_state(imp, state);                                 \
00096         }                                                                      \
00097 } while(0)
00098 
00099 #define IMPORT_SET_STATE(imp, state)                                    \
00100 do {                                                                    \
00101         spin_lock(&imp->imp_lock);                                      \
00102         IMPORT_SET_STATE_NOLOCK(imp, state);                            \
00103         spin_unlock(&imp->imp_lock);                                    \
00104 } while(0)
00105 
00106 void ptlrpc_import_enter_resend(struct obd_import *imp)
00107 {
00108         IMPORT_SET_STATE(imp, LUSTRE_IMP_RECOVER);
00109 }
00110 EXPORT_SYMBOL(ptlrpc_import_enter_resend);

00113 static int ptlrpc_connect_interpret(const struct lu_env *env,
00114                                     struct ptlrpc_request *request,
00115                                     void * data, int rc);
00116 int ptlrpc_import_recovery_state_machine(struct obd_import *imp);
00117 
00118 /* Only this function is allowed to change the import state when it is
00119  * CLOSED. I would rather refcount the import and free it after
00120  * disconnection like we do with exports. To do that, the client_obd
00121  * will need to save the peer info somewhere other than in the import,
00122  * though. */
00123 int ptlrpc_init_import(struct obd_import *imp)
00124 {
00125         spin_lock(&imp->imp_lock);
00126 
00127         imp->imp_generation++;
00128         imp->imp_state =  LUSTRE_IMP_NEW;
00129 
00130         spin_unlock(&imp->imp_lock);
00131 
00132         return 0;
00133 }
00134 EXPORT_SYMBOL(ptlrpc_init_import);
00135 
00136 #define UUID_STR "_UUID"
00137 void deuuidify(char *uuid, const char *prefix, char **uuid_start, int *uuid_len)
00138 {
00139         *uuid_start = !prefix || strncmp(uuid, prefix, strlen(prefix))
00140                 ? uuid : uuid + strlen(prefix);
00141 
00142         *uuid_len = strlen(*uuid_start);
00143 
00144         if (*uuid_len < strlen(UUID_STR))
00145                 return;
00146 
00147         if (!strncmp(*uuid_start + *uuid_len - strlen(UUID_STR),
00148                     UUID_STR, strlen(UUID_STR)))
00149                 *uuid_len -= strlen(UUID_STR);
00150 }
00151 
00163 int ptlrpc_set_import_discon(struct obd_import *imp, __u32 conn_cnt)
00164 {
00165         int rc = 0;
00166 
00167         spin_lock(&imp->imp_lock);
00168 
00169         if (imp->imp_state == LUSTRE_IMP_FULL &&
00170             (conn_cnt == 0 || conn_cnt == imp->imp_conn_cnt)) {
00171                 char *target_start;
00172                 int   target_len;
00173 
00174                 deuuidify(obd2cli_tgt(imp->imp_obd), NULL,
00175                           &target_start, &target_len);
00176 
00177                 if (imp->imp_replayable) {
00178                         LCONSOLE_WARN("%s: Connection to %.*s (at %s) was "
00179                                "lost; in progress operations using this "
00180                                "service will wait for recovery to complete\n",
00181                                imp->imp_obd->obd_name, target_len, target_start,
00182                                libcfs_nid2str(imp->imp_connection->c_peer.nid));
00183                 } else {
00184                         LCONSOLE_ERROR_MSG(0x166, "%s: Connection to "
00185                                "%.*s (at %s) was lost; in progress "
00186                                "operations using this service will fail\n",
00187                                imp->imp_obd->obd_name,
00188                                target_len, target_start,
00189                                libcfs_nid2str(imp->imp_connection->c_peer.nid));
00190                 }
00191                 IMPORT_SET_STATE_NOLOCK(imp, LUSTRE_IMP_DISCON);
00192                 spin_unlock(&imp->imp_lock);
00193 
00194                 if (obd_dump_on_timeout)
00195                         libcfs_debug_dumplog();
00196 
00197                 obd_import_event(imp->imp_obd, imp, IMP_EVENT_DISCON);
00198                 rc = 1;
00199         } else {
00200                 spin_unlock(&imp->imp_lock);
00201                 CDEBUG(D_HA, "%s: import %p already %s (conn %u, was %u): %s\n",
00202                        imp->imp_client->cli_name, imp,
00203                        (imp->imp_state == LUSTRE_IMP_FULL &&
00204                         imp->imp_conn_cnt > conn_cnt) ?
00205                        "reconnected" : "not connected", imp->imp_conn_cnt,
00206                        conn_cnt, ptlrpc_import_state_name(imp->imp_state));
00207         }
00208 
00209         return rc;
00210 }
00211 
00212 /* Must be called with imp_lock held! */
00213 static void ptlrpc_deactivate_and_unlock_import(struct obd_import *imp)
00214 {
00215         ENTRY;
00216         assert_spin_locked(&imp->imp_lock);
00217 
00218         CDEBUG(D_HA, "setting import %s INVALID\n", obd2cli_tgt(imp->imp_obd));
00219         imp->imp_invalid = 1;
00220         imp->imp_generation++;
00221         spin_unlock(&imp->imp_lock);
00222 
00223         ptlrpc_abort_inflight(imp);
00224         obd_import_event(imp->imp_obd, imp, IMP_EVENT_INACTIVE);
00225 
00226         EXIT;
00227 }
00228 
00229 /*
00230  * This acts as a barrier; all existing requests are rejected, and
00231  * no new requests will be accepted until the import is valid again.
00232  */
00233 void ptlrpc_deactivate_import(struct obd_import *imp)
00234 {
00235         spin_lock(&imp->imp_lock);
00236         ptlrpc_deactivate_and_unlock_import(imp);
00237 }
00238 EXPORT_SYMBOL(ptlrpc_deactivate_import);
00239 
00240 static unsigned int
00241 ptlrpc_inflight_deadline(struct ptlrpc_request *req, time_t now)
00242 {
00243         long dl;
00244 
00245         if (!(((req->rq_phase == RQ_PHASE_RPC) && !req->rq_waiting) ||
00246               (req->rq_phase == RQ_PHASE_BULK) ||
00247               (req->rq_phase == RQ_PHASE_NEW)))
00248                 return 0;
00249 
00250         if (req->rq_timedout)
00251                 return 0;
00252 
00253         if (req->rq_phase == RQ_PHASE_NEW)
00254                 dl = req->rq_sent;
00255         else
00256                 dl = req->rq_deadline;
00257 
00258         if (dl <= now)
00259                 return 0;
00260 
00261         return dl - now;
00262 }
00263 
00264 static unsigned int ptlrpc_inflight_timeout(struct obd_import *imp)
00265 {
00266         time_t now = cfs_time_current_sec();
00267         struct list_head *tmp, *n;
00268         struct ptlrpc_request *req;
00269         unsigned int timeout = 0;
00270 
00271         spin_lock(&imp->imp_lock);
00272         list_for_each_safe(tmp, n, &imp->imp_sending_list) {
00273                 req = list_entry(tmp, struct ptlrpc_request, rq_list);
00274                 timeout = max(ptlrpc_inflight_deadline(req, now), timeout);
00275         }
00276         spin_unlock(&imp->imp_lock);
00277         return timeout;
00278 }
00279 
00286 void ptlrpc_invalidate_import(struct obd_import *imp)
00287 {
00288         struct list_head *tmp, *n;
00289         struct ptlrpc_request *req;
00290         struct l_wait_info lwi;
00291         unsigned int timeout;
00292         int rc;
00293 
00294         atomic_inc(&imp->imp_inval_count);
00295 
00296         if (!imp->imp_invalid || imp->imp_obd->obd_no_recov)
00297                 ptlrpc_deactivate_import(imp);
00298 
00299         CFS_FAIL_TIMEOUT(OBD_FAIL_MGS_CONNECT_NET, 3 * cfs_fail_val / 2);
00300         LASSERT(imp->imp_invalid);
00301 
00302         /* Wait forever until inflight == 0. We really can't do it another
00303          * way because in some cases we need to wait for very long reply
00304          * unlink. We can't do anything before that because there is really
00305          * no guarantee that some rdma transfer is not in progress right now. */
00306         do {
00307                 /* Calculate max timeout for waiting on rpcs to error
00308                  * out. Use obd_timeout if calculated value is smaller
00309                  * than it. */
00310                 if (!OBD_FAIL_CHECK(OBD_FAIL_PTLRPC_LONG_REPL_UNLINK)) {
00311                         timeout = ptlrpc_inflight_timeout(imp);
00312                         timeout += timeout / 3;
00313 
00314                         if (timeout == 0)
00315                                 timeout = obd_timeout;
00316                 } else {
00317                         /* decrease the interval to increase race condition */
00318                         timeout = 1;
00319                 }
00320 
00321                 CDEBUG(D_RPCTRACE,"Sleeping %d sec for inflight to error out\n",
00322                        timeout);
00323 
00324                 /* Wait for all requests to error out and call completion
00325                  * callbacks. Cap it at obd_timeout -- these should all
00326                  * have been locally cancelled by ptlrpc_abort_inflight. */
00327                 lwi = LWI_TIMEOUT_INTERVAL(
00328                         cfs_timeout_cap(cfs_time_seconds(timeout)),
00329                         (timeout > 1)?cfs_time_seconds(1):cfs_time_seconds(1)/2,
00330                         NULL, NULL);
00331                 rc = l_wait_event(imp->imp_recovery_waitq,
00332                                   (atomic_read(&imp->imp_inflight) == 0),
00333                                   &lwi);
00334                 if (rc) {
00335                         const char *cli_tgt = obd2cli_tgt(imp->imp_obd);
00336 
00337                         CERROR("%s: rc = %d waiting for callback (%d != 0)\n",
00338                                cli_tgt, rc, atomic_read(&imp->imp_inflight));
00339 
00340                         spin_lock(&imp->imp_lock);
00341                         if (atomic_read(&imp->imp_inflight) == 0) {
00342                                 int count = atomic_read(&imp->imp_unregistering);
00343 
00344                                 /* We know that "unregistering" rpcs only can
00345                                  * survive in sending or delaying lists (they
00346                                  * maybe waiting for long reply unlink in
00347                                  * sluggish nets). Let's check this. If there
00348                                  * is no inflight and unregistering != 0, this
00349                                  * is bug. */
00350                                 LASSERTF(count == 0, "Some RPCs are still "
00351                                          "unregistering: %d\n", count);
00352 
00353                                 /* Let's save one loop as soon as inflight have
00354                                  * dropped to zero. No new inflights possible at
00355                                  * this point. */
00356                                 rc = 0;
00357                         } else {
00358                                 list_for_each_safe(tmp, n,
00359                                                    &imp->imp_sending_list) {
00360                                         req = list_entry(tmp,
00361                                                          struct ptlrpc_request,
00362                                                          rq_list);
00363                                         DEBUG_REQ(D_ERROR, req,
00364                                                   "still on sending list");
00365                                 }
00366                                 list_for_each_safe(tmp, n,
00367                                                    &imp->imp_delayed_list) {
00368                                         req = list_entry(tmp,
00369                                                          struct ptlrpc_request,
00370                                                          rq_list);
00371                                         DEBUG_REQ(D_ERROR, req,
00372                                                   "still on delayed list");
00373                                 }
00374 
00375                                 CERROR("%s: RPCs in \"%s\" phase found (%d). "
00376                                        "Network is sluggish? Waiting them "
00377                                        "to error out.\n", cli_tgt,
00378                                        ptlrpc_phase2str(RQ_PHASE_UNREGISTERING),
00379                                        atomic_read(&imp->imp_unregistering));
00380                         }
00381                         spin_unlock(&imp->imp_lock);
00382                 }
00383         } while (rc != 0);
00384 
00385         /*
00386          * Let's additionally check that no new rpcs added to import in
00387          * "invalidate" state.
00388          */
00389         LASSERT(atomic_read(&imp->imp_inflight) == 0);
00390         obd_import_event(imp->imp_obd, imp, IMP_EVENT_INVALIDATE);
00391         sptlrpc_import_flush_all_ctx(imp);
00392 
00393         atomic_dec(&imp->imp_inval_count);
00394         wake_up_all(&imp->imp_recovery_waitq);
00395 }
00396 EXPORT_SYMBOL(ptlrpc_invalidate_import);
00397 
00398 /* unset imp_invalid */
00399 void ptlrpc_activate_import(struct obd_import *imp)
00400 {
00401         struct obd_device *obd = imp->imp_obd;
00402 
00403         spin_lock(&imp->imp_lock);
00404         if (imp->imp_deactive != 0) {
00405                 spin_unlock(&imp->imp_lock);
00406                 return;
00407         }
00408 
00409         imp->imp_invalid = 0;
00410         spin_unlock(&imp->imp_lock);
00411         obd_import_event(obd, imp, IMP_EVENT_ACTIVE);
00412 }
00413 EXPORT_SYMBOL(ptlrpc_activate_import);
00414 
00415 void ptlrpc_pinger_force(struct obd_import *imp)
00416 {
00417         CDEBUG(D_HA, "%s: waking up pinger s:%s\n", obd2cli_tgt(imp->imp_obd),
00418                ptlrpc_import_state_name(imp->imp_state));
00419 
00420         spin_lock(&imp->imp_lock);
00421         imp->imp_force_verify = 1;
00422         spin_unlock(&imp->imp_lock);
00423 
00424         if (imp->imp_state != LUSTRE_IMP_CONNECTING)
00425                 ptlrpc_pinger_wake_up();
00426 }
00427 EXPORT_SYMBOL(ptlrpc_pinger_force);
00428 
00429 void ptlrpc_fail_import(struct obd_import *imp, __u32 conn_cnt)
00430 {
00431         ENTRY;
00432 
00433         LASSERT(!imp->imp_dlm_fake);
00434 
00435         if (ptlrpc_set_import_discon(imp, conn_cnt)) {
00436                 if (!imp->imp_replayable) {
00437                         CDEBUG(D_HA, "import %s@%s for %s not replayable, "
00438                                "auto-deactivating\n",
00439                                obd2cli_tgt(imp->imp_obd),
00440                                imp->imp_connection->c_remote_uuid.uuid,
00441                                imp->imp_obd->obd_name);
00442                         ptlrpc_deactivate_import(imp);
00443                 }
00444 
00445                 ptlrpc_pinger_force(imp);
00446         }
00447         EXIT;
00448 }
00449 
00450 int ptlrpc_reconnect_import(struct obd_import *imp)
00451 {
00452 #ifdef ENABLE_PINGER
00453         struct l_wait_info lwi;
00454         int secs = cfs_time_seconds(obd_timeout);
00455         int rc;
00456 
00457         ptlrpc_pinger_force(imp);
00458 
00459         CDEBUG(D_HA, "%s: recovery started, waiting %u seconds\n",
00460                obd2cli_tgt(imp->imp_obd), secs);
00461 
00462         lwi = LWI_TIMEOUT(secs, NULL, NULL);
00463         rc = l_wait_event(imp->imp_recovery_waitq,
00464                           !ptlrpc_import_in_recovery(imp), &lwi);
00465         CDEBUG(D_HA, "%s: recovery finished s:%s\n", obd2cli_tgt(imp->imp_obd),
00466                ptlrpc_import_state_name(imp->imp_state));
00467         return rc;
00468 #else
00469         ptlrpc_set_import_discon(imp, 0);
00470         /* Force a new connect attempt */
00471         ptlrpc_invalidate_import(imp);
00472         /* Do a fresh connect next time by zeroing the handle */
00473         ptlrpc_disconnect_import(imp, 1);
00474         /* Wait for all invalidate calls to finish */
00475         if (atomic_read(&imp->imp_inval_count) > 0) {
00476                 struct l_wait_info lwi = LWI_INTR(LWI_ON_SIGNAL_NOOP, NULL);
00477                 int rc;
00478 
00479                 rc = l_wait_event(imp->imp_recovery_waitq,
00480                                   (atomic_read(&imp->imp_inval_count) == 0),
00481                                   &lwi);
00482                 if (rc)
00483                         CERROR("Interrupted, inval=%d\n",
00484                                atomic_read(&imp->imp_inval_count));
00485         }
00486 
00487         /* Allow reconnect attempts */
00488         imp->imp_obd->obd_no_recov = 0;
00489         /* Remove 'invalid' flag */
00490         ptlrpc_activate_import(imp);
00491         /* Attempt a new connect */
00492         ptlrpc_recover_import(imp, NULL, 0);
00493         return 0;
00494 #endif
00495 }
00496 EXPORT_SYMBOL(ptlrpc_reconnect_import);
00497 
00503 static int import_select_connection(struct obd_import *imp)
00504 {
00505         struct obd_import_conn *imp_conn = NULL, *conn;
00506         struct obd_export *dlmexp;
00507         char *target_start;
00508         int target_len, tried_all = 1;
00509         ENTRY;
00510 
00511         spin_lock(&imp->imp_lock);
00512 
00513         if (list_empty(&imp->imp_conn_list)) {
00514                 CERROR("%s: no connections available\n",
00515                        imp->imp_obd->obd_name);
00516                 spin_unlock(&imp->imp_lock);
00517                 RETURN(-EINVAL);
00518         }
00519 
00520         list_for_each_entry(conn, &imp->imp_conn_list, oic_item) {
00521                 CDEBUG(D_HA, "%s: connect to NID %s last attempt "LPU64"\n",
00522                        imp->imp_obd->obd_name,
00523                        libcfs_nid2str(conn->oic_conn->c_peer.nid),
00524                        conn->oic_last_attempt);
00525 
00526                 /* If we have not tried this connection since
00527                    the last successful attempt, go with this one */
00528                 if ((conn->oic_last_attempt == 0) ||
00529                     cfs_time_beforeq_64(conn->oic_last_attempt,
00530                                        imp->imp_last_success_conn)) {
00531                         imp_conn = conn;
00532                         tried_all = 0;
00533                         break;
00534                 }
00535 
00536                 /* If all of the connections have already been tried
00537                    since the last successful connection; just choose the
00538                    least recently used */
00539                 if (!imp_conn)
00540                         imp_conn = conn;
00541                 else if (cfs_time_before_64(conn->oic_last_attempt,
00542                                             imp_conn->oic_last_attempt))
00543                         imp_conn = conn;
00544         }
00545 
00546         /* if not found, simply choose the current one */
00547         if (!imp_conn || imp->imp_force_reconnect) {
00548                 LASSERT(imp->imp_conn_current);
00549                 imp_conn = imp->imp_conn_current;
00550                 tried_all = 0;
00551         }
00552         LASSERT(imp_conn->oic_conn);
00553 
00554         /* If we've tried everything, and we're back to the beginning of the
00555            list, increase our timeout and try again. It will be reset when
00556            we do finally connect. (FIXME: really we should wait for all network
00557            state associated with the last connection attempt to drain before
00558            trying to reconnect on it.) */
00559         if (tried_all && (imp->imp_conn_list.next == &imp_conn->oic_item)) {
00560                 struct adaptive_timeout *at = &imp->imp_at.iat_net_latency;
00561                 if (at_get(at) < CONNECTION_SWITCH_MAX) {
00562                         at_measured(at, at_get(at) + CONNECTION_SWITCH_INC);
00563                         if (at_get(at) > CONNECTION_SWITCH_MAX)
00564                                 at_reset(at, CONNECTION_SWITCH_MAX);
00565                 }
00566                 LASSERT(imp_conn->oic_last_attempt);
00567                 CDEBUG(D_HA, "%s: tried all connections, increasing latency "
00568                         "to %ds\n", imp->imp_obd->obd_name, at_get(at));
00569         }
00570 
00571         imp_conn->oic_last_attempt = cfs_time_current_64();
00572 
00573         /* switch connection, don't mind if it's same as the current one */
00574         if (imp->imp_connection)
00575                 ptlrpc_connection_put(imp->imp_connection);
00576         imp->imp_connection = ptlrpc_connection_addref(imp_conn->oic_conn);
00577 
00578         dlmexp =  class_conn2export(&imp->imp_dlm_handle);
00579         LASSERT(dlmexp != NULL);
00580         if (dlmexp->exp_connection)
00581                 ptlrpc_connection_put(dlmexp->exp_connection);
00582         dlmexp->exp_connection = ptlrpc_connection_addref(imp_conn->oic_conn);
00583         class_export_put(dlmexp);
00584 
00585         if (imp->imp_conn_current != imp_conn) {
00586                 if (imp->imp_conn_current) {
00587                         deuuidify(obd2cli_tgt(imp->imp_obd), NULL,
00588                                   &target_start, &target_len);
00589 
00590                         CDEBUG(D_HA, "%s: Connection changing to"
00591                                " %.*s (at %s)\n",
00592                                imp->imp_obd->obd_name,
00593                                target_len, target_start,
00594                                libcfs_nid2str(imp_conn->oic_conn->c_peer.nid));
00595                 }
00596 
00597                 imp->imp_conn_current = imp_conn;
00598         }
00599 
00600         CDEBUG(D_HA, "%s: import %p using connection %s/%s\n",
00601                imp->imp_obd->obd_name, imp, imp_conn->oic_uuid.uuid,
00602                libcfs_nid2str(imp_conn->oic_conn->c_peer.nid));
00603 
00604         spin_unlock(&imp->imp_lock);
00605 
00606         RETURN(0);
00607 }
00608 
00609 /*
00610  * must be called under imp_lock
00611  */
00612 static int ptlrpc_first_transno(struct obd_import *imp, __u64 *transno)
00613 {
00614         struct ptlrpc_request   *req;
00615         struct list_head        *tmp;
00616 
00617         /* The requests in committed_list always have smaller transnos than
00618          * the requests in replay_list */
00619         if (!list_empty(&imp->imp_committed_list)) {
00620                 tmp = imp->imp_committed_list.next;
00621                 req = list_entry(tmp, struct ptlrpc_request, rq_replay_list);
00622                 *transno = req->rq_transno;
00623                 if (req->rq_transno == 0) {
00624                         DEBUG_REQ(D_ERROR, req, "zero transno in committed_list");
00625                         LBUG();
00626                 }
00627                 return 1;
00628         }
00629         if (!list_empty(&imp->imp_replay_list)) {
00630                 tmp = imp->imp_replay_list.next;
00631                 req = list_entry(tmp, struct ptlrpc_request, rq_replay_list);
00632                 *transno = req->rq_transno;
00633                 if (req->rq_transno == 0) {
00634                         DEBUG_REQ(D_ERROR, req, "zero transno in replay_list");
00635                         LBUG();
00636                 }
00637                 return 1;
00638         }
00639         return 0;
00640 }
00641 
00648 int ptlrpc_connect_import(struct obd_import *imp)
00649 {
00650         struct obd_device *obd = imp->imp_obd;
00651         int initial_connect = 0;
00652         int set_transno = 0;
00653         __u64 committed_before_reconnect = 0;
00654         struct ptlrpc_request *request;
00655         char *bufs[] = { NULL,
00656                          obd2cli_tgt(imp->imp_obd),
00657                          obd->obd_uuid.uuid,
00658                          (char *)&imp->imp_dlm_handle,
00659                          (char *)&imp->imp_connect_data };
00660         struct ptlrpc_connect_async_args *aa;
00661         int rc;
00662         ENTRY;
00663 
00664         spin_lock(&imp->imp_lock);
00665         if (imp->imp_state == LUSTRE_IMP_CLOSED) {
00666                 spin_unlock(&imp->imp_lock);
00667                 CERROR("can't connect to a closed import\n");
00668                 RETURN(-EINVAL);
00669         } else if (imp->imp_state == LUSTRE_IMP_FULL) {
00670                 spin_unlock(&imp->imp_lock);
00671                 CERROR("already connected\n");
00672                 RETURN(0);
00673         } else if (imp->imp_state == LUSTRE_IMP_CONNECTING ||
00674                    imp->imp_connected) {
00675                 spin_unlock(&imp->imp_lock);
00676                 CERROR("already connecting\n");
00677                 RETURN(-EALREADY);
00678         }
00679 
00680         IMPORT_SET_STATE_NOLOCK(imp, LUSTRE_IMP_CONNECTING);
00681 
00682         imp->imp_conn_cnt++;
00683         imp->imp_resend_replay = 0;
00684 
00685         if (!lustre_handle_is_used(&imp->imp_remote_handle))
00686                 initial_connect = 1;
00687         else
00688                 committed_before_reconnect = imp->imp_peer_committed_transno;
00689 
00690         set_transno = ptlrpc_first_transno(imp,
00691                                            &imp->imp_connect_data.ocd_transno);
00692         spin_unlock(&imp->imp_lock);
00693 
00694         rc = import_select_connection(imp);
00695         if (rc)
00696                 GOTO(out, rc);
00697 
00698         rc = sptlrpc_import_sec_adapt(imp, NULL, NULL);
00699         if (rc)
00700                 GOTO(out, rc);
00701 
00702         /* Reset connect flags to the originally requested flags, in case
00703          * the server is updated on-the-fly we will get the new features. */
00704         imp->imp_connect_data.ocd_connect_flags = imp->imp_connect_flags_orig;
00705         /* Reset ocd_version each time so the server knows the exact versions */
00706         imp->imp_connect_data.ocd_version = LUSTRE_VERSION_CODE;
00707         imp->imp_msghdr_flags &= ~MSGHDR_AT_SUPPORT;
00708         imp->imp_msghdr_flags &= ~MSGHDR_CKSUM_INCOMPAT18;
00709 
00710         rc = obd_reconnect(NULL, imp->imp_obd->obd_self_export, obd,
00711                            &obd->obd_uuid, &imp->imp_connect_data, NULL);
00712         if (rc)
00713                 GOTO(out, rc);
00714 
00715         request = ptlrpc_request_alloc(imp, &RQF_MDS_CONNECT);
00716         if (request == NULL)
00717                 GOTO(out, rc = -ENOMEM);
00718 
00719         rc = ptlrpc_request_bufs_pack(request, LUSTRE_OBD_VERSION,
00720                                       imp->imp_connect_op, bufs, NULL);
00721         if (rc) {
00722                 ptlrpc_request_free(request);
00723                 GOTO(out, rc);
00724         }
00725 
00726         /* Report the rpc service time to the server so that it knows how long
00727          * to wait for clients to join recovery */
00728         lustre_msg_set_service_time(request->rq_reqmsg,
00729                                     at_timeout2est(request->rq_timeout));
00730 
00731         /* The amount of time we give the server to process the connect req.
00732          * import_select_connection will increase the net latency on
00733          * repeated reconnect attempts to cover slow networks.
00734          * We override/ignore the server rpc completion estimate here,
00735          * which may be large if this is a reconnect attempt */
00736         request->rq_timeout = INITIAL_CONNECT_TIMEOUT;
00737         lustre_msg_set_timeout(request->rq_reqmsg, request->rq_timeout);
00738 
00739         request->rq_no_resend = request->rq_no_delay = 1;
00740         request->rq_send_state = LUSTRE_IMP_CONNECTING;
00741         /* Allow a slightly larger reply for future growth compatibility */
00742         req_capsule_set_size(&request->rq_pill, &RMF_CONNECT_DATA, RCL_SERVER,
00743                              sizeof(struct obd_connect_data)+16*sizeof(__u64));
00744         ptlrpc_request_set_replen(request);
00745         request->rq_interpret_reply = ptlrpc_connect_interpret;
00746 
00747         CLASSERT(sizeof (*aa) <= sizeof (request->rq_async_args));
00748         aa = ptlrpc_req_async_args(request);
00749         memset(aa, 0, sizeof *aa);
00750 
00751         aa->pcaa_peer_committed = committed_before_reconnect;
00752         aa->pcaa_initial_connect = initial_connect;
00753 
00754         if (aa->pcaa_initial_connect) {
00755                 spin_lock(&imp->imp_lock);
00756                 imp->imp_replayable = 1;
00757                 spin_unlock(&imp->imp_lock);
00758                 lustre_msg_add_op_flags(request->rq_reqmsg,
00759                                         MSG_CONNECT_INITIAL);
00760         }
00761 
00762         if (set_transno)
00763                 lustre_msg_add_op_flags(request->rq_reqmsg,
00764                                         MSG_CONNECT_TRANSNO);
00765 
00766         DEBUG_REQ(D_RPCTRACE, request, "(re)connect request (timeout %d)",
00767                   request->rq_timeout);
00768         ptlrpcd_add_req(request);
00769         rc = 0;
00770 out:
00771         if (rc != 0)
00772                 IMPORT_SET_STATE(imp, LUSTRE_IMP_DISCON);
00773 
00774         RETURN(rc);
00775 }
00776 EXPORT_SYMBOL(ptlrpc_connect_import);
00777 
00778 static void ptlrpc_maybe_ping_import_soon(struct obd_import *imp)
00779 {
00780         int force_verify;
00781 
00782         spin_lock(&imp->imp_lock);
00783         force_verify = imp->imp_force_verify != 0;
00784         spin_unlock(&imp->imp_lock);
00785 
00786         if (force_verify)
00787                 ptlrpc_pinger_wake_up();
00788 }
00789 
00790 static int ptlrpc_busy_reconnect(int rc)
00791 {
00792         return (rc == -EBUSY) || (rc == -EAGAIN);
00793 }
00794 
00795 static int ptlrpc_connect_set_flags(struct obd_import *imp,
00796                                      struct obd_connect_data *ocd,
00797                                      __u64 old_connect_flags,
00798                                      struct obd_export *exp, int init_connect)
00799 {
00800         static bool warned;
00801         struct client_obd *cli = &imp->imp_obd->u.cli;
00802 
00803         if ((imp->imp_connect_flags_orig & OBD_CONNECT_IBITS) &&
00804             !(ocd->ocd_connect_flags & OBD_CONNECT_IBITS)) {
00805                 LCONSOLE_WARN("%s: MDS %s does not support ibits "
00806                               "lock, either very old or invalid: "
00807                               "requested "LPX64", replied "LPX64"\n",
00808                               imp->imp_obd->obd_name,
00809                               imp->imp_connection->c_remote_uuid.uuid,
00810                               imp->imp_connect_flags_orig,
00811                               ocd->ocd_connect_flags);
00812                 return -EPROTO;
00813         }
00814 
00815         spin_lock(&imp->imp_lock);
00816         list_del(&imp->imp_conn_current->oic_item);
00817         list_add(&imp->imp_conn_current->oic_item,
00818                  &imp->imp_conn_list);
00819         imp->imp_last_success_conn =
00820                 imp->imp_conn_current->oic_last_attempt;
00821 
00822         spin_unlock(&imp->imp_lock);
00823 
00824 
00825         if (!warned && (ocd->ocd_connect_flags & OBD_CONNECT_VERSION) &&
00826             (ocd->ocd_version > LUSTRE_VERSION_CODE +
00827                                 LUSTRE_VERSION_OFFSET_WARN ||
00828              ocd->ocd_version < LUSTRE_VERSION_CODE -
00829                                 LUSTRE_VERSION_OFFSET_WARN)) {
00830                 /* Sigh, some compilers do not like #ifdef in the middle
00831                    of macro arguments */
00832                 const char *older = "older than client. "
00833                                     "Consider upgrading server";
00834                 const char *newer = "newer than client. "
00835                                     "Consider recompiling application";
00836 
00837                 LCONSOLE_WARN("Server %s version (%d.%d.%d.%d) "
00838                               "is much %s (%s)\n",
00839                               obd2cli_tgt(imp->imp_obd),
00840                               OBD_OCD_VERSION_MAJOR(ocd->ocd_version),
00841                               OBD_OCD_VERSION_MINOR(ocd->ocd_version),
00842                               OBD_OCD_VERSION_PATCH(ocd->ocd_version),
00843                               OBD_OCD_VERSION_FIX(ocd->ocd_version),
00844                               ocd->ocd_version > LUSTRE_VERSION_CODE ?
00845                               newer : older, LUSTRE_VERSION_STRING);
00846                 warned = true;
00847         }
00848 
00849 #if LUSTRE_VERSION_CODE < OBD_OCD_VERSION(3, 0, 53, 0)
00850         /* Check if server has LU-1252 fix applied to not always swab
00851          * the IR MNE entries. Do this only once per connection.  This
00852          * fixup is version-limited, because we don't want to carry the
00853          * OBD_CONNECT_MNE_SWAB flag around forever, just so long as we
00854          * need interop with unpatched 2.2 servers.  For newer servers,
00855          * the client will do MNE swabbing only as needed.  LU-1644 */
00856         if (unlikely((ocd->ocd_connect_flags & OBD_CONNECT_VERSION) &&
00857                      !(ocd->ocd_connect_flags & OBD_CONNECT_MNE_SWAB) &&
00858                      OBD_OCD_VERSION_MAJOR(ocd->ocd_version) == 2 &&
00859                      OBD_OCD_VERSION_MINOR(ocd->ocd_version) == 2 &&
00860                      OBD_OCD_VERSION_PATCH(ocd->ocd_version) < 55 &&
00861                      strcmp(imp->imp_obd->obd_type->typ_name,
00862                             LUSTRE_MGC_NAME) == 0))
00863                 imp->imp_need_mne_swab = 1;
00864         else /* clear if server was upgraded since last connect */
00865                 imp->imp_need_mne_swab = 0;
00866 #endif
00867 
00868         if (ocd->ocd_connect_flags & OBD_CONNECT_CKSUM) {
00869                 /* We sent to the server ocd_cksum_types with bits set
00870                  * for algorithms we understand. The server masked off
00871                  * the checksum types it doesn't support */
00872                 if ((ocd->ocd_cksum_types &
00873                      cksum_types_supported_client()) == 0) {
00874                         LCONSOLE_WARN("The negotiation of the checksum "
00875                                       "alogrithm to use with server %s "
00876                                       "failed (%x/%x), disabling "
00877                                       "checksums\n",
00878                                       obd2cli_tgt(imp->imp_obd),
00879                                       ocd->ocd_cksum_types,
00880                                       cksum_types_supported_client());
00881                         cli->cl_checksum = 0;
00882                         cli->cl_supp_cksum_types = OBD_CKSUM_ADLER;
00883                 } else {
00884                         cli->cl_supp_cksum_types = ocd->ocd_cksum_types;
00885                 }
00886         } else {
00887                 /* The server does not support OBD_CONNECT_CKSUM.
00888                  * Enforce ADLER for backward compatibility*/
00889                 cli->cl_supp_cksum_types = OBD_CKSUM_ADLER;
00890         }
00891         cli->cl_cksum_type = cksum_type_select(cli->cl_supp_cksum_types);
00892 
00893         if (ocd->ocd_connect_flags & OBD_CONNECT_BRW_SIZE)
00894                 cli->cl_max_pages_per_rpc =
00895                         min(ocd->ocd_brw_size >> PAGE_CACHE_SHIFT,
00896                             cli->cl_max_pages_per_rpc);
00897         else if (imp->imp_connect_op == MDS_CONNECT ||
00898                  imp->imp_connect_op == MGS_CONNECT)
00899                 cli->cl_max_pages_per_rpc = 1;
00900 
00901         LASSERT((cli->cl_max_pages_per_rpc <= PTLRPC_MAX_BRW_PAGES) &&
00902                 (cli->cl_max_pages_per_rpc > 0));
00903 
00904         client_adjust_max_dirty(cli);
00905 
00906         /* Update client max modify RPCs in flight with value returned
00907          * by the server */
00908         if (ocd->ocd_connect_flags & OBD_CONNECT_MULTIMODRPCS)
00909                 cli->cl_max_mod_rpcs_in_flight = min(
00910                                         cli->cl_max_mod_rpcs_in_flight,
00911                                         ocd->ocd_maxmodrpcs);
00912         else
00913                 cli->cl_max_mod_rpcs_in_flight = 1;
00914 
00915         /* Reset ns_connect_flags only for initial connect. It might be
00916          * changed in while using FS and if we reset it in reconnect
00917          * this leads to losing user settings done before such as
00918          * disable lru_resize, etc. */
00919         if (old_connect_flags != exp_connect_flags(exp) || init_connect) {
00920                 CDEBUG(D_HA, "%s: Resetting ns_connect_flags to server "
00921                              "flags: "LPX64"\n", imp->imp_obd->obd_name,
00922                              ocd->ocd_connect_flags);
00923                 imp->imp_obd->obd_namespace->ns_connect_flags =
00924                         ocd->ocd_connect_flags;
00925                 imp->imp_obd->obd_namespace->ns_orig_connect_flags =
00926                         ocd->ocd_connect_flags;
00927         }
00928 
00929         if (ocd->ocd_connect_flags & OBD_CONNECT_AT)
00930                 /* We need a per-message support flag, because
00931                  * a. we don't know if the incoming connect reply
00932                  *    supports AT or not (in reply_in_callback)
00933                  *    until we unpack it.
00934                  * b. failovered server means export and flags are gone
00935                  *    (in ptlrpc_send_reply).
00936                  *    Can only be set when we know AT is supported at
00937                  *    both ends */
00938                 imp->imp_msghdr_flags |= MSGHDR_AT_SUPPORT;
00939         else
00940                 imp->imp_msghdr_flags &= ~MSGHDR_AT_SUPPORT;
00941 
00942         imp->imp_msghdr_flags |= MSGHDR_CKSUM_INCOMPAT18;
00943 
00944         return 0;
00945 }
00946 
00952 static void ptlrpc_prepare_replay(struct obd_import *imp)
00953 {
00954         struct ptlrpc_request *req;
00955 
00956         if (imp->imp_state != LUSTRE_IMP_REPLAY ||
00957             imp->imp_resend_replay)
00958                 return;
00959 
00960         /* If the server was restart during repaly, the requests may
00961          * have been added to the unreplied list in former replay. */
00962         spin_lock(&imp->imp_lock);
00963 
00964         list_for_each_entry(req, &imp->imp_committed_list, rq_replay_list) {
00965                 if (list_empty(&req->rq_unreplied_list))
00966                         ptlrpc_add_unreplied(req);
00967         }
00968 
00969         list_for_each_entry(req, &imp->imp_replay_list, rq_replay_list) {
00970                 if (list_empty(&req->rq_unreplied_list))
00971                         ptlrpc_add_unreplied(req);
00972         }
00973 
00974         imp->imp_known_replied_xid = ptlrpc_known_replied_xid(imp);
00975         spin_unlock(&imp->imp_lock);
00976 }
00977 
00984 static int ptlrpc_connect_interpret(const struct lu_env *env,
00985                                     struct ptlrpc_request *request,
00986                                     void *data, int rc)
00987 {
00988         struct ptlrpc_connect_async_args *aa = data;
00989         struct obd_import *imp = request->rq_import;
00990         struct lustre_handle old_hdl;
00991         __u64 old_connect_flags;
00992         int msg_flags;
00993         struct obd_connect_data *ocd;
00994         struct obd_export *exp;
00995         int ret;
00996         ENTRY;
00997 
00998         spin_lock(&imp->imp_lock);
00999         if (imp->imp_state == LUSTRE_IMP_CLOSED) {
01000                 imp->imp_connect_tried = 1;
01001                 spin_unlock(&imp->imp_lock);
01002                 RETURN(0);
01003         }
01004 
01005         if (rc) {
01006                 /* if this reconnect to busy export - not need select new target
01007                  * for connecting*/
01008                 imp->imp_force_reconnect = ptlrpc_busy_reconnect(rc);
01009                 spin_unlock(&imp->imp_lock);
01010                 ptlrpc_maybe_ping_import_soon(imp);
01011                 GOTO(out, rc);
01012         }
01013 
01014         /* LU-7558: indicate that we are interpretting connect reply,
01015          * pltrpc_connect_import() will not try to reconnect until
01016          * interpret will finish. */
01017         imp->imp_connected = 1;
01018         spin_unlock(&imp->imp_lock);
01019 
01020         LASSERT(imp->imp_conn_current);
01021 
01022         msg_flags = lustre_msg_get_op_flags(request->rq_repmsg);
01023 
01024         ret = req_capsule_get_size(&request->rq_pill, &RMF_CONNECT_DATA,
01025                                    RCL_SERVER);
01026         /* server replied obd_connect_data is always bigger */
01027         ocd = req_capsule_server_sized_get(&request->rq_pill,
01028                                            &RMF_CONNECT_DATA, ret);
01029 
01030         if (ocd == NULL) {
01031                 CERROR("%s: no connect data from server\n",
01032                        imp->imp_obd->obd_name);
01033                 rc = -EPROTO;
01034                 GOTO(out, rc);
01035         }
01036 
01037         spin_lock(&imp->imp_lock);
01038 
01039         /* All imports are pingable */
01040         imp->imp_pingable = 1;
01041         imp->imp_force_reconnect = 0;
01042         imp->imp_force_verify = 0;
01043 
01044         imp->imp_connect_data = *ocd;
01045 
01046         CDEBUG(D_HA, "%s: connect to target with instance %u\n",
01047                imp->imp_obd->obd_name, ocd->ocd_instance);
01048         exp = class_conn2export(&imp->imp_dlm_handle);
01049 
01050         spin_unlock(&imp->imp_lock);
01051 
01052         /* check that server granted subset of flags we asked for. */
01053         if ((ocd->ocd_connect_flags & imp->imp_connect_flags_orig) !=
01054             ocd->ocd_connect_flags) {
01055                 CERROR("%s: Server didn't granted asked subset of flags: "
01056                        "asked="LPX64" grranted="LPX64"\n",
01057                        imp->imp_obd->obd_name,imp->imp_connect_flags_orig,
01058                        ocd->ocd_connect_flags);
01059                 GOTO(out, rc = -EPROTO);
01060         }
01061 
01062         if (!(imp->imp_connect_flags_orig & OBD_CONNECT_LIGHTWEIGHT) &&
01063             (imp->imp_connect_flags_orig & OBD_CONNECT_MDS_MDS) &&
01064             (imp->imp_connect_flags_orig & OBD_CONNECT_FID) &&
01065             (ocd->ocd_connect_flags & OBD_CONNECT_VERSION)) {
01066                 __u32 major = OBD_OCD_VERSION_MAJOR(ocd->ocd_version);
01067                 __u32 minor = OBD_OCD_VERSION_MINOR(ocd->ocd_version);
01068                 __u32 patch = OBD_OCD_VERSION_PATCH(ocd->ocd_version);
01069 
01070                 /* We do not support the MDT-MDT interoperations with
01071                  * different version MDT because of protocol changes. */
01072                 if (unlikely(major != LUSTRE_MAJOR ||
01073                              minor != LUSTRE_MINOR ||
01074                              abs(patch - LUSTRE_PATCH) > 3)) {
01075                         LCONSOLE_WARN("%s: import %p (%u.%u.%u.%u) tried the "
01076                                       "connection to different version MDT "
01077                                       "(%d.%d.%d.%d) %s\n",
01078                                       imp->imp_obd->obd_name, imp, LUSTRE_MAJOR,
01079                                       LUSTRE_MINOR, LUSTRE_PATCH, LUSTRE_FIX,
01080                                       major, minor, patch,
01081                                       OBD_OCD_VERSION_FIX(ocd->ocd_version),
01082                                       imp->imp_connection->c_remote_uuid.uuid);
01083 
01084                         GOTO(out, rc = -EPROTO);
01085                 }
01086         }
01087 
01088         if (!exp) {
01089                 /* This could happen if export is cleaned during the
01090                    connect attempt */
01091                 CERROR("%s: missing export after connect\n",
01092                        imp->imp_obd->obd_name);
01093                 GOTO(out, rc = -ENODEV);
01094         }
01095         old_connect_flags = exp_connect_flags(exp);
01096         exp->exp_connect_data = *ocd;
01097         imp->imp_obd->obd_self_export->exp_connect_data = *ocd;
01098 
01099         /* The net statistics after (re-)connect is not valid anymore,
01100          * because may reflect other routing, etc. */
01101         at_reinit(&imp->imp_at.iat_net_latency, 0, 0);
01102         ptlrpc_at_adj_net_latency(request,
01103                         lustre_msg_get_service_time(request->rq_repmsg));
01104 
01105         /* Import flags should be updated before waking import at FULL state */
01106         rc = ptlrpc_connect_set_flags(imp, ocd, old_connect_flags, exp,
01107                                  aa->pcaa_initial_connect);
01108         class_export_put(exp);
01109         if (rc != 0)
01110                 GOTO(out, rc);
01111 
01112         obd_import_event(imp->imp_obd, imp, IMP_EVENT_OCD);
01113 
01114         if (aa->pcaa_initial_connect) {
01115                 spin_lock(&imp->imp_lock);
01116                 if (msg_flags & MSG_CONNECT_REPLAYABLE) {
01117                         imp->imp_replayable = 1;
01118                         spin_unlock(&imp->imp_lock);
01119                         CDEBUG(D_HA, "connected to replayable target: %s\n",
01120                                obd2cli_tgt(imp->imp_obd));
01121                 } else {
01122                         imp->imp_replayable = 0;
01123                         spin_unlock(&imp->imp_lock);
01124                 }
01125 
01126                 /* if applies, adjust the imp->imp_msg_magic here
01127                  * according to reply flags */
01128 
01129                 imp->imp_remote_handle =
01130                                 *lustre_msg_get_handle(request->rq_repmsg);
01131 
01132                 /* Initial connects are allowed for clients with non-random
01133                  * uuids when servers are in recovery.  Simply signal the
01134                  * servers replay is complete and wait in REPLAY_WAIT. */
01135                 if (msg_flags & MSG_CONNECT_RECOVERING) {
01136                         CDEBUG(D_HA, "connect to %s during recovery\n",
01137                                obd2cli_tgt(imp->imp_obd));
01138                         IMPORT_SET_STATE(imp, LUSTRE_IMP_REPLAY_LOCKS);
01139                 } else {
01140                         IMPORT_SET_STATE(imp, LUSTRE_IMP_FULL);
01141                         ptlrpc_activate_import(imp);
01142                 }
01143 
01144                 GOTO(finish, rc = 0);
01145         }
01146 
01147         /* Determine what recovery state to move the import to. */
01148         if (MSG_CONNECT_RECONNECT & msg_flags) {
01149                 memset(&old_hdl, 0, sizeof(old_hdl));
01150                 if (!memcmp(&old_hdl, lustre_msg_get_handle(request->rq_repmsg),
01151                             sizeof (old_hdl))) {
01152                         LCONSOLE_WARN("Reconnect to %s (at @%s) failed due "
01153                                       "bad handle "LPX64"\n",
01154                                       obd2cli_tgt(imp->imp_obd),
01155                                       imp->imp_connection->c_remote_uuid.uuid,
01156                                       imp->imp_dlm_handle.cookie);
01157                         GOTO(out, rc = -ENOTCONN);
01158                 }
01159 
01160                 if (memcmp(&imp->imp_remote_handle,
01161                            lustre_msg_get_handle(request->rq_repmsg),
01162                            sizeof(imp->imp_remote_handle))) {
01163                         int level = msg_flags & MSG_CONNECT_RECOVERING ?
01164                                 D_HA : D_WARNING;
01165 
01166                         /* Bug 16611/14775: if server handle have changed,
01167                          * that means some sort of disconnection happened.
01168                          * If the server is not in recovery, that also means it
01169                          * already erased all of our state because of previous
01170                          * eviction. If it is in recovery - we are safe to
01171                          * participate since we can reestablish all of our state
01172                          * with server again */
01173                         if ((MSG_CONNECT_RECOVERING & msg_flags)) {
01174                                 CDEBUG(level,"%s@%s changed server handle from "
01175                                        LPX64" to "LPX64
01176                                        " but is still in recovery\n",
01177                                        obd2cli_tgt(imp->imp_obd),
01178                                        imp->imp_connection->c_remote_uuid.uuid,
01179                                        imp->imp_remote_handle.cookie,
01180                                        lustre_msg_get_handle(
01181                                        request->rq_repmsg)->cookie);
01182                         } else {
01183                                 LCONSOLE_WARN("Evicted from %s (at %s) "
01184                                               "after server handle changed from "
01185                                               LPX64" to "LPX64"\n",
01186                                               obd2cli_tgt(imp->imp_obd),
01187                                               imp->imp_connection-> \
01188                                               c_remote_uuid.uuid,
01189                                               imp->imp_remote_handle.cookie,
01190                                               lustre_msg_get_handle(
01191                                               request->rq_repmsg)->cookie);
01192                         }
01193 
01194 
01195                         imp->imp_remote_handle =
01196                                      *lustre_msg_get_handle(request->rq_repmsg);
01197 
01198                         if (!(MSG_CONNECT_RECOVERING & msg_flags)) {
01199                                 IMPORT_SET_STATE(imp, LUSTRE_IMP_EVICTED);
01200                                 GOTO(finish, rc = 0);
01201                         }
01202 
01203                 } else {
01204                         CDEBUG(D_HA, "reconnected to %s@%s after partition\n",
01205                                obd2cli_tgt(imp->imp_obd),
01206                                imp->imp_connection->c_remote_uuid.uuid);
01207                 }
01208 
01209                 if (imp->imp_invalid) {
01210                         CDEBUG(D_HA, "%s: reconnected but import is invalid; "
01211                                "marking evicted\n", imp->imp_obd->obd_name);
01212                         IMPORT_SET_STATE(imp, LUSTRE_IMP_EVICTED);
01213                 } else if (MSG_CONNECT_RECOVERING & msg_flags) {
01214                         CDEBUG(D_HA, "%s: reconnected to %s during replay\n",
01215                                imp->imp_obd->obd_name,
01216                                obd2cli_tgt(imp->imp_obd));
01217 
01218                         spin_lock(&imp->imp_lock);
01219                         imp->imp_resend_replay = 1;
01220                         spin_unlock(&imp->imp_lock);
01221 
01222                         IMPORT_SET_STATE(imp, imp->imp_replay_state);
01223                 } else {
01224                         IMPORT_SET_STATE(imp, LUSTRE_IMP_RECOVER);
01225                 }
01226         } else if ((MSG_CONNECT_RECOVERING & msg_flags) && !imp->imp_invalid) {
01227                 LASSERT(imp->imp_replayable);
01228                 imp->imp_remote_handle =
01229                                 *lustre_msg_get_handle(request->rq_repmsg);
01230                 imp->imp_last_replay_transno = 0;
01231                 imp->imp_replay_cursor = &imp->imp_committed_list;
01232                 IMPORT_SET_STATE(imp, LUSTRE_IMP_REPLAY);
01233         } else {
01234                 DEBUG_REQ(D_HA, request, "%s: evicting (reconnect/recover flags"
01235                           " not set: %x)", imp->imp_obd->obd_name, msg_flags);
01236                 imp->imp_remote_handle =
01237                                 *lustre_msg_get_handle(request->rq_repmsg);
01238                 IMPORT_SET_STATE(imp, LUSTRE_IMP_EVICTED);
01239         }
01240 
01241         /* Sanity checks for a reconnected import. */
01242         if (!(imp->imp_replayable) != !(msg_flags & MSG_CONNECT_REPLAYABLE)) {
01243                 CERROR("imp_replayable flag does not match server "
01244                        "after reconnect. We should LBUG right here.\n");
01245         }
01246 
01247         if (lustre_msg_get_last_committed(request->rq_repmsg) > 0 &&
01248             lustre_msg_get_last_committed(request->rq_repmsg) <
01249             aa->pcaa_peer_committed) {
01250                 CERROR("%s went back in time (transno "LPD64
01251                        " was previously committed, server now claims "LPD64
01252                        ")!  See https://bugzilla.lustre.org/show_bug.cgi?"
01253                        "id=9646\n",
01254                        obd2cli_tgt(imp->imp_obd), aa->pcaa_peer_committed,
01255                        lustre_msg_get_last_committed(request->rq_repmsg));
01256         }
01257 
01258 finish:
01259         ptlrpc_prepare_replay(imp);
01260         rc = ptlrpc_import_recovery_state_machine(imp);
01261         if (rc == -ENOTCONN) {
01262                 CDEBUG(D_HA, "evicted/aborted by %s@%s during recovery;"
01263                        "invalidating and reconnecting\n",
01264                        obd2cli_tgt(imp->imp_obd),
01265                        imp->imp_connection->c_remote_uuid.uuid);
01266                 ptlrpc_connect_import(imp);
01267                 spin_lock(&imp->imp_lock);
01268                 imp->imp_connected = 0;
01269                 imp->imp_connect_tried = 1;
01270                 spin_unlock(&imp->imp_lock);
01271                 RETURN(0);
01272         }
01273 
01274 out:
01275         spin_lock(&imp->imp_lock);
01276         imp->imp_connected = 0;
01277         imp->imp_connect_tried = 1;
01278         spin_unlock(&imp->imp_lock);
01279 
01280         if (rc != 0) {
01281                 IMPORT_SET_STATE(imp, LUSTRE_IMP_DISCON);
01282                 if (rc == -EACCES) {
01283                         /*
01284                          * Give up trying to reconnect
01285                          * EACCES means client has no permission for connection
01286                          */
01287                         imp->imp_obd->obd_no_recov = 1;
01288                         ptlrpc_deactivate_import(imp);
01289                 }
01290 
01291                 if (rc == -EPROTO) {
01292                         struct obd_connect_data *ocd;
01293 
01294                         /* reply message might not be ready */
01295                         if (request->rq_repmsg == NULL)
01296                                 RETURN(-EPROTO);
01297 
01298                         ocd = req_capsule_server_get(&request->rq_pill,
01299                                                      &RMF_CONNECT_DATA);
01300                         if (ocd &&
01301                             (ocd->ocd_connect_flags & OBD_CONNECT_VERSION) &&
01302                             (ocd->ocd_version != LUSTRE_VERSION_CODE)) {
01303                            /* Actually servers are only supposed to refuse
01304                               connection from liblustre clients, so we should
01305                               never see this from VFS context */
01306                                 LCONSOLE_ERROR_MSG(0x16a, "Server %s version "
01307                                         "(%d.%d.%d.%d)"
01308                                         " refused connection from this client "
01309                                         "with an incompatible version (%s).  "
01310                                         "Client must be recompiled\n",
01311                                         obd2cli_tgt(imp->imp_obd),
01312                                         OBD_OCD_VERSION_MAJOR(ocd->ocd_version),
01313                                         OBD_OCD_VERSION_MINOR(ocd->ocd_version),
01314                                         OBD_OCD_VERSION_PATCH(ocd->ocd_version),
01315                                         OBD_OCD_VERSION_FIX(ocd->ocd_version),
01316                                         LUSTRE_VERSION_STRING);
01317                                 ptlrpc_deactivate_import(imp);
01318                                 IMPORT_SET_STATE(imp, LUSTRE_IMP_CLOSED);
01319                         }
01320                         RETURN(-EPROTO);
01321                 }
01322 
01323                 ptlrpc_maybe_ping_import_soon(imp);
01324 
01325                 CDEBUG(D_HA, "recovery of %s on %s failed (%d)\n",
01326                        obd2cli_tgt(imp->imp_obd),
01327                        (char *)imp->imp_connection->c_remote_uuid.uuid, rc);
01328         }
01329 
01330         wake_up_all(&imp->imp_recovery_waitq);
01331         RETURN(rc);
01332 }
01333 
01338 static int completed_replay_interpret(const struct lu_env *env,
01339                                       struct ptlrpc_request *req,
01340                                       void * data, int rc)
01341 {
01342         ENTRY;
01343         atomic_dec(&req->rq_import->imp_replay_inflight);
01344         if (req->rq_status == 0 &&
01345             !req->rq_import->imp_vbr_failed) {
01346                 ptlrpc_import_recovery_state_machine(req->rq_import);
01347         } else {
01348                 if (req->rq_import->imp_vbr_failed) {
01349                         CDEBUG(D_WARNING,
01350                                "%s: version recovery fails, reconnecting\n",
01351                                req->rq_import->imp_obd->obd_name);
01352                 } else {
01353                         CDEBUG(D_HA, "%s: LAST_REPLAY message error: %d, "
01354                                      "reconnecting\n",
01355                                req->rq_import->imp_obd->obd_name,
01356                                req->rq_status);
01357                 }
01358                 ptlrpc_connect_import(req->rq_import);
01359         }
01360 
01361         RETURN(0);
01362 }
01363 
01368 static int signal_completed_replay(struct obd_import *imp)
01369 {
01370         struct ptlrpc_request *req;
01371         ENTRY;
01372 
01373         if (unlikely(OBD_FAIL_CHECK(OBD_FAIL_PTLRPC_FINISH_REPLAY)))
01374                 RETURN(0);
01375 
01376         LASSERT(atomic_read(&imp->imp_replay_inflight) == 0);
01377         atomic_inc(&imp->imp_replay_inflight);
01378 
01379         req = ptlrpc_request_alloc_pack(imp, &RQF_OBD_PING, LUSTRE_OBD_VERSION,
01380                                         OBD_PING);
01381         if (req == NULL) {
01382                 atomic_dec(&imp->imp_replay_inflight);
01383                 RETURN(-ENOMEM);
01384         }
01385 
01386         ptlrpc_request_set_replen(req);
01387         req->rq_send_state = LUSTRE_IMP_REPLAY_WAIT;
01388         lustre_msg_add_flags(req->rq_reqmsg,
01389                              MSG_LOCK_REPLAY_DONE | MSG_REQ_REPLAY_DONE);
01390         if (AT_OFF)
01391                 req->rq_timeout *= 3;
01392         req->rq_interpret_reply = completed_replay_interpret;
01393 
01394         ptlrpcd_add_req(req);
01395         RETURN(0);
01396 }
01397 
01403 static int ptlrpc_invalidate_import_thread(void *data)
01404 {
01405         struct obd_import *imp = data;
01406 
01407         ENTRY;
01408 
01409         unshare_fs_struct();
01410 
01411         CDEBUG(D_HA, "thread invalidate import %s to %s@%s\n",
01412                imp->imp_obd->obd_name, obd2cli_tgt(imp->imp_obd),
01413                imp->imp_connection->c_remote_uuid.uuid);
01414 
01415         ptlrpc_invalidate_import(imp);
01416 
01417         if (obd_dump_on_eviction) {
01418                 CERROR("dump the log upon eviction\n");
01419                 libcfs_debug_dumplog();
01420         }
01421 
01422         IMPORT_SET_STATE(imp, LUSTRE_IMP_RECOVER);
01423         ptlrpc_import_recovery_state_machine(imp);
01424 
01425         class_import_put(imp);
01426         RETURN(0);
01427 }
01428 
01449 int ptlrpc_import_recovery_state_machine(struct obd_import *imp)
01450 {
01451         int rc = 0;
01452         int inflight;
01453         char *target_start;
01454         int target_len;
01455 
01456         ENTRY;
01457         if (imp->imp_state == LUSTRE_IMP_EVICTED) {
01458                 deuuidify(obd2cli_tgt(imp->imp_obd), NULL,
01459                           &target_start, &target_len);
01460                 /* Don't care about MGC eviction */
01461                 if (strcmp(imp->imp_obd->obd_type->typ_name,
01462                            LUSTRE_MGC_NAME) != 0) {
01463                         LCONSOLE_ERROR_MSG(0x167, "%s: This client was evicted "
01464                                            "by %.*s; in progress operations "
01465                                            "using this service will fail.\n",
01466                                            imp->imp_obd->obd_name, target_len,
01467                                            target_start);
01468                 }
01469                 CDEBUG(D_HA, "evicted from %s@%s; invalidating\n",
01470                        obd2cli_tgt(imp->imp_obd),
01471                        imp->imp_connection->c_remote_uuid.uuid);
01472                 /* reset vbr_failed flag upon eviction */
01473                 spin_lock(&imp->imp_lock);
01474                 imp->imp_vbr_failed = 0;
01475                 spin_unlock(&imp->imp_lock);
01476 
01477                 {
01478                 struct task_struct *task;
01479                 /* bug 17802:  XXX client_disconnect_export vs connect request
01480                  * race. if client is evicted at this time then we start
01481                  * invalidate thread without reference to import and import can
01482                  * be freed at same time. */
01483                 class_import_get(imp);
01484                 task = kthread_run(ptlrpc_invalidate_import_thread, imp,
01485                                      "ll_imp_inval");
01486                 if (IS_ERR(task)) {
01487                         class_import_put(imp);
01488                         CERROR("error starting invalidate thread: %d\n", rc);
01489                         rc = PTR_ERR(task);
01490                 } else {
01491                         rc = 0;
01492                 }
01493                 RETURN(rc);
01494                 }
01495         }
01496 
01497         if (imp->imp_state == LUSTRE_IMP_REPLAY) {
01498                 CDEBUG(D_HA, "replay requested by %s\n",
01499                        obd2cli_tgt(imp->imp_obd));
01500                 rc = ptlrpc_replay_next(imp, &inflight);
01501                 if (inflight == 0 &&
01502                     atomic_read(&imp->imp_replay_inflight) == 0) {
01503                         IMPORT_SET_STATE(imp, LUSTRE_IMP_REPLAY_LOCKS);
01504                         rc = ldlm_replay_locks(imp);
01505                         if (rc)
01506                                 GOTO(out, rc);
01507                 }
01508                 rc = 0;
01509         }
01510 
01511         if (imp->imp_state == LUSTRE_IMP_REPLAY_LOCKS) {
01512                 if (atomic_read(&imp->imp_replay_inflight) == 0) {
01513                         IMPORT_SET_STATE(imp, LUSTRE_IMP_REPLAY_WAIT);
01514                         rc = signal_completed_replay(imp);
01515                         if (rc)
01516                                 GOTO(out, rc);
01517                 }
01518         }
01519 
01520         if (imp->imp_state == LUSTRE_IMP_REPLAY_WAIT) {
01521                 if (atomic_read(&imp->imp_replay_inflight) == 0) {
01522                         IMPORT_SET_STATE(imp, LUSTRE_IMP_RECOVER);
01523                 }
01524         }
01525 
01526         if (imp->imp_state == LUSTRE_IMP_RECOVER) {
01527                 struct ptlrpc_connection *conn = imp->imp_connection;
01528 
01529                 rc = ptlrpc_resend(imp);
01530                 if (rc)
01531                         GOTO(out, rc);
01532                 IMPORT_SET_STATE(imp, LUSTRE_IMP_FULL);
01533                 ptlrpc_activate_import(imp);
01534 
01535                 LCONSOLE_INFO("%s: Connection restored to %s (at %s)\n",
01536                               imp->imp_obd->obd_name,
01537                               obd_uuid2str(&conn->c_remote_uuid),
01538                               libcfs_nid2str(imp->imp_connection->c_peer.nid));
01539         }
01540 
01541         if (imp->imp_state == LUSTRE_IMP_FULL) {
01542                 wake_up_all(&imp->imp_recovery_waitq);
01543                 ptlrpc_wake_delayed(imp);
01544         }
01545 
01546 out:
01547         RETURN(rc);
01548 }
01549 
01550 int ptlrpc_disconnect_import(struct obd_import *imp, int noclose)
01551 {
01552         struct ptlrpc_request *req;
01553         int rq_opc, rc = 0;
01554         ENTRY;
01555 
01556         if (imp->imp_obd->obd_force)
01557                 GOTO(set_state, rc);
01558 
01559         switch (imp->imp_connect_op) {
01560         case OST_CONNECT:
01561                 rq_opc = OST_DISCONNECT;
01562                 break;
01563         case MDS_CONNECT:
01564                 rq_opc = MDS_DISCONNECT;
01565                 break;
01566         case MGS_CONNECT:
01567                 rq_opc = MGS_DISCONNECT;
01568                 break;
01569         default:
01570                 rc = -EINVAL;
01571                 CERROR("%s: don't know how to disconnect from %s "
01572                        "(connect_op %d): rc = %d\n",
01573                        imp->imp_obd->obd_name, obd2cli_tgt(imp->imp_obd),
01574                        imp->imp_connect_op, rc);
01575                 RETURN(rc);
01576         }
01577 
01578         if (ptlrpc_import_in_recovery(imp)) {
01579                 struct l_wait_info lwi;
01580                 cfs_duration_t timeout;
01581 
01582                 if (AT_OFF) {
01583                         if (imp->imp_server_timeout)
01584                                 timeout = cfs_time_seconds(obd_timeout / 2);
01585                         else
01586                                 timeout = cfs_time_seconds(obd_timeout);
01587                 } else {
01588                         int idx = import_at_get_index(imp,
01589                                 imp->imp_client->cli_request_portal);
01590                         timeout = cfs_time_seconds(
01591                                 at_get(&imp->imp_at.iat_service_estimate[idx]));
01592                 }
01593 
01594                 lwi = LWI_TIMEOUT_INTR(cfs_timeout_cap(timeout),
01595                                        back_to_sleep, LWI_ON_SIGNAL_NOOP, NULL);
01596                 rc = l_wait_event(imp->imp_recovery_waitq,
01597                                   !ptlrpc_import_in_recovery(imp), &lwi);
01598 
01599         }
01600 
01601         spin_lock(&imp->imp_lock);
01602         if (imp->imp_state != LUSTRE_IMP_FULL)
01603                 GOTO(out, rc);
01604         spin_unlock(&imp->imp_lock);
01605 
01606         req = ptlrpc_request_alloc_pack(imp, &RQF_MDS_DISCONNECT,
01607                                         LUSTRE_OBD_VERSION, rq_opc);
01608         if (req) {
01609                 /* We are disconnecting, do not retry a failed DISCONNECT rpc if
01610                  * it fails.  We can get through the above with a down server
01611                  * if the client doesn't know the server is gone yet. */
01612                 req->rq_no_resend = 1;
01613 
01614                 /* We want client umounts to happen quickly, no matter the
01615                    server state... */
01616                 req->rq_timeout = min_t(int, req->rq_timeout,
01617                                         INITIAL_CONNECT_TIMEOUT);
01618 
01619                 IMPORT_SET_STATE(imp, LUSTRE_IMP_CONNECTING);
01620                 req->rq_send_state =  LUSTRE_IMP_CONNECTING;
01621                 ptlrpc_request_set_replen(req);
01622                 rc = ptlrpc_queue_wait(req);
01623                 ptlrpc_req_finished(req);
01624         }
01625 
01626 set_state:
01627         spin_lock(&imp->imp_lock);
01628 out:
01629         if (noclose)
01630                 IMPORT_SET_STATE_NOLOCK(imp, LUSTRE_IMP_DISCON);
01631         else
01632                 IMPORT_SET_STATE_NOLOCK(imp, LUSTRE_IMP_CLOSED);
01633         memset(&imp->imp_remote_handle, 0, sizeof(imp->imp_remote_handle));
01634         spin_unlock(&imp->imp_lock);
01635 
01636         if (rc == -ETIMEDOUT || rc == -ENOTCONN || rc == -ESHUTDOWN)
01637                 rc = 0;
01638         RETURN(rc);
01639 }
01640 EXPORT_SYMBOL(ptlrpc_disconnect_import);
01641 
01642 void ptlrpc_cleanup_imp(struct obd_import *imp)
01643 {
01644         ENTRY;
01645 
01646         spin_lock(&imp->imp_lock);
01647         IMPORT_SET_STATE_NOLOCK(imp, LUSTRE_IMP_CLOSED);
01648         imp->imp_generation++;
01649         spin_unlock(&imp->imp_lock);
01650         ptlrpc_abort_inflight(imp);
01651 
01652         EXIT;
01653 }
01654 
01655 /* Adaptive Timeout utils */
01656 extern unsigned int at_min, at_max, at_history;
01657 
01658 /* Update at_current with the specified value (bounded by at_min and at_max),
01659  * as well as the AT history "bins".
01660  *  - Bin into timeslices using AT_BINS bins.
01661  *  - This gives us a max of the last at_history seconds without the storage,
01662  *    but still smoothing out a return to normalcy from a slow response.
01663  *  - (E.g. remember the maximum latency in each minute of the last 4 minutes.)
01664  */
01665 int at_measured(struct adaptive_timeout *at, unsigned int val)
01666 {
01667         unsigned int old = at->at_current;
01668         time_t now = cfs_time_current_sec();
01669         time_t binlimit = max_t(time_t, at_history / AT_BINS, 1);
01670 
01671         LASSERT(at);
01672         CDEBUG(D_OTHER, "add %u to %p time=%lu v=%u (%u %u %u %u)\n",
01673                val, at, now - at->at_binstart, at->at_current,
01674                at->at_hist[0], at->at_hist[1], at->at_hist[2], at->at_hist[3]);
01675 
01676         if (val == 0)
01677                 /* 0's don't count, because we never want our timeout to
01678                    drop to 0, and because 0 could mean an error */
01679                 return 0;
01680 
01681         spin_lock(&at->at_lock);
01682 
01683         if (unlikely(at->at_binstart == 0)) {
01684                 /* Special case to remove default from history */
01685                 at->at_current = val;
01686                 at->at_worst_ever = val;
01687                 at->at_worst_time = now;
01688                 at->at_hist[0] = val;
01689                 at->at_binstart = now;
01690         } else if (now - at->at_binstart < binlimit ) {
01691                 /* in bin 0 */
01692                 at->at_hist[0] = max(val, at->at_hist[0]);
01693                 at->at_current = max(val, at->at_current);
01694         } else {
01695                 int i, shift;
01696                 unsigned int maxv = val;
01697                 /* move bins over */
01698                 shift = (now - at->at_binstart) / binlimit;
01699                 LASSERT(shift > 0);
01700                 for(i = AT_BINS - 1; i >= 0; i--) {
01701                         if (i >= shift) {
01702                                 at->at_hist[i] = at->at_hist[i - shift];
01703                                 maxv = max(maxv, at->at_hist[i]);
01704                         } else {
01705                                 at->at_hist[i] = 0;
01706                         }
01707                 }
01708                 at->at_hist[0] = val;
01709                 at->at_current = maxv;
01710                 at->at_binstart += shift * binlimit;
01711         }
01712 
01713         if (at->at_current > at->at_worst_ever) {
01714                 at->at_worst_ever = at->at_current;
01715                 at->at_worst_time = now;
01716         }
01717 
01718         if (at->at_flags & AT_FLG_NOHIST)
01719                 /* Only keep last reported val; keeping the rest of the history
01720                    for proc only */
01721                 at->at_current = val;
01722 
01723         if (at_max > 0)
01724                 at->at_current =  min(at->at_current, at_max);
01725         at->at_current =  max(at->at_current, at_min);
01726 
01727         if (at->at_current != old)
01728                 CDEBUG(D_OTHER, "AT %p change: old=%u new=%u delta=%d "
01729                        "(val=%u) hist %u %u %u %u\n", at,
01730                        old, at->at_current, at->at_current - old, val,
01731                        at->at_hist[0], at->at_hist[1], at->at_hist[2],
01732                        at->at_hist[3]);
01733 
01734         /* if we changed, report the old value */
01735         old = (at->at_current != old) ? old : 0;
01736 
01737         spin_unlock(&at->at_lock);
01738         return old;
01739 }
01740 
01741 /* Find the imp_at index for a given portal; assign if space available */
01742 int import_at_get_index(struct obd_import *imp, int portal)
01743 {
01744         struct imp_at *at = &imp->imp_at;
01745         int i;
01746 
01747         for (i = 0; i < IMP_AT_MAX_PORTALS; i++) {
01748                 if (at->iat_portal[i] == portal)
01749                         return i;
01750                 if (at->iat_portal[i] == 0)
01751                         /* unused */
01752                         break;
01753         }
01754 
01755         /* Not found in list, add it under a lock */
01756         spin_lock(&imp->imp_lock);
01757 
01758         /* Check unused under lock */
01759         for (; i < IMP_AT_MAX_PORTALS; i++) {
01760                 if (at->iat_portal[i] == portal)
01761                         goto out;
01762                 if (at->iat_portal[i] == 0)
01763                         /* unused */
01764                         break;
01765         }
01766 
01767         /* Not enough portals? */
01768         LASSERT(i < IMP_AT_MAX_PORTALS);
01769 
01770         at->iat_portal[i] = portal;
01771 out:
01772         spin_unlock(&imp->imp_lock);
01773         return i;
01774 }
